text: jamovi wrapper pwrss package üî¨üî¨üî¨üî¨ CONSTRUCTION üõ†‚õîÔ∏è‚ö†Ô∏èüî© pwrss: Statistical Power Sample Size Calculation Tools https://cran.r-project.org/web/packages/pwrss/vignettes/examples.html http://pwrss.shinyapps.io/lang-tr http://pwrss.shinyapps.io/lang-en PowerUpR: Power Analysis Tools Multilevel Randomized Experiments https://powerupr.shinyapps.io/index/

what: Template for a Basic jamovi Module
title: Jamovi Module for Statistical Power and Sample Size Calculation Tools
Jamovi Module for Statistical Power and Sample Size Calculation Tools
text: Use repo template: https://github.com/sbalci/jpwrss generate new repo Use R >= 4.0.2 Current package repository : https://cran.microsoft.com/snapshot/2020-08-24 Install jamovi Get latest (1.6.3) https://www.jamovi.org/download.html Install jmvtools package : Install jamovi package family: Locate jamovi bin folder: windows: jmvtools::check("C://Program Files//jamovi//bin") recommend changing folder name default jamovi x.x jamovi mac: jmvtools::check("~/Applications/jamovi.app") devtools::document() jmvtools::prepare(home = ‚ÄúC://Program Files//jamovi 2.3.26.0//bin‚Äù) Inside repo folder R run jmvtools::install() file named jpwrss.jmo install module jamovi repo like R package except jamovi folder. need edit R/...b.R files. https://dev.jamovi.org/tuts0104-implementing--analysis.html https://dev.jamovi.org/tuts0105-debugging--analysis.html run jmvtools::install() . Let know goes :)
code: install.packages('jmvtools', repos=c('https://repo.jamovi.org', 'https://cran.r-project.org')) suppressPackageStartupMessages({   if (!requireNamespace('jmvtools'))   {     install.packages('jmvtools',                      repos = c('https://repo.jamovi.org', 'https://cran.r-project.org'))   } }) suppressPackageStartupMessages(library('jmvtools'))  suppressPackageStartupMessages({   if (!requireNamespace('jmv')) {     install.packages('jmv', dependencies = TRUE)   } }) suppressPackageStartupMessages(library('jmv'))  suppressPackageStartupMessages({   if (!requireNamespace('jmvconnect')) {     install.packages('jmvconnect', dependencies = TRUE)   } }) suppressPackageStartupMessages(library('jmvconnect'))  suppressPackageStartupMessages({   if (!requireNamespace('jmvcore')) {     install.packages('jmvcore', dependencies = TRUE)   } }) suppressPackageStartupMessages(library('jmvcore'))  suppressPackageStartupMessages({   if (!require('devtools')) {     install.packages('devtools')   } }) suppressPackageStartupMessages(library('devtools'))

code: flatpak install -y flathub org.freedesktop.Platform//19.08 flatpak install -y flathub org.freedesktop.Sdk//19.08  sudo apt install flatpak sudo apt install gnome-software-plugin-flatpak flatpak remote-add --if-not-exists flathub https://flathub.org/repo/flathub.flatpakrepo flatpak install flathub org.jamovi.jamovi flatpak run org.jamovi.jamovi flatpak remote-add --if-not-exists flathub https://flathub.org/repo/flathub.flatpakrepo flatpak install flathub org.freedesktop.Sdk//19.08 flatpak install flathub org.freedesktop.Platform//19.08  sudo apt install flatpak-builder flatpak-builder --run build_folder org.app.json sudo add-apt-repository 'deb https://cloud.r-project.org/bin/linux/ubuntu focal-cran40/' sudo apt install r-base r-base-core r-recommended r-base-dev sudo apt install '/home/serdarbalci/Downloads/rstudio-1.3.1073-amd64.deb' sudo apt install git-all sudo apt install libcanberra-gtk-module libcanberra-gtk3-module sudo apt-get install libv8-dev sudo apt-get install libnode-dev   sudo apt install build-essential gcc --version sudo apt-get install gfortran  sudo apt-get install r-base-dev git status   sudo apt install libcurl4-openssl-dev sudo apt install libxml2-dev

what: Jamovi Module for Statistical Power and Sample Size Calculation Tools ‚Äî jpwrss-package
title: Jamovi Module for Statistical Power and Sample Size Calculation Tools ‚Äî jpwrss-package
text: `jpwrss` jpwrss Wrapper `jamovi` Module `pwrss` Package Statistical power minimum required sample size calculations (1) testing proportion (one-sample) constant, (2) testing mean (one-sample) constant, (3) testing difference two proportions (independent samples), (4) testing difference two means groups (parametric non-parametric tests independent paired samples), (5) testing correlation (one-sample) constant, (6) testing difference two correlations (independent samples), (7) testing single coefficient multiple linear regression, logistic regression, Poisson regression (standardized unstandardized coefficients, covariates covariate adjusted), (8) testing indirect effect (standardized unstandardized coefficients, covariates covariate adjusted) mediation analysis (Sobel, Joint, Monte Carlo tests), (9) testing R-squared zero linear regression, (10) testing R-squared difference zero hierarchical regression, (11) testing eta-squared f-squared (main interaction effects) zero analysis variance (one-way, two-way, three-way), (12) testing eta-squared f-squared (main interaction effects) zero analysis covariance (one-way, two-way, three-way), (13) testing eta-squared f-squared (, within, interaction effects) zero one-way repeated measures analysis variance (non-sphericity correction repeated measures correlation), (14) testing goodness--fit independence contingency tables. Alternative hypothesis can formulated "equal", "less", "greater", "non-inferior", "superior", "equivalent" (1), (2), (3), (4); "equal", "less", "greater" (5), (6), (7) (8); always "greater" (9), (10), (11), (12), (13), (14). Reference: Bulus Polat (2023) <https://osf.io/ua5fc>. help researchers generate natural language summaries dataset, generate cross tables statistical tests, survival analysis survival tables, survival plots, natural language summaries. documentation, see Website.
